result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew O Hoff Jr

records.addlTxt: CASES: 22CF345 & 22CM122. 10:00 AM Defendant Matthew O Hoff Jr in court.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for Matthew O Hoff Jr.  Attorney David Stilin in court for State of Wisconsin. RL-clerk. CT quashes stayed warrant. Atty Chapman requesting a competency evaluation. Def updates his address. CT finds PC in both files. CT orders competency evaluation in both files. CT- ADA to submit competency orders and counsel to schedule competency hearing with JA. CT orders def to cooperate with evaluation. Bond cont. 10:08 am adj.

ADDRESS INFO for Matthew O Hoff Jr
Current: 220 Oak Street, Clear Lake, WI 54005 United States  (Effective: 10-21-2022)
Prior: 1112 174th Avenue, New Richmond, WI 54017
NOH returned from 1112 174th Avenue, New Richmond, WI. "Not Deliverable as Addressed"

CASES: 22CF345 & 22CM122. 9:14 AM Defendant Matthew O Hoff Jr not in court. Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for Matthew O Hoff Jr. Attorney Holly D. Wood Webster in court for State of Wisconsin. RL-clerk. Atty Chapman addresses ct, indicates def is ill. Requests another STC and atty Chapman was just appointed on Friday. No obj by state. CT authorizes warrant but stays it until next court date on 10/21/22. 9:15 am adj.
Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on October 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
